When a small group of living beings (a small population) is separated from the main population from which it originates (e.g., if they migrate over a mountain range or across a river, or if they settle on a new island so that they cannot easily return), they often find themselves in a different environment than before.

This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so that the new population needs different characteristics or adaptations to be a strong competitor, rather than what it needed before.
The original population has not changed at all. It still needs the same adaptations as before.
Over time, the new population begins to adapt to its new environment, and then it looks less and less like the other population.
After thousands or even millions of years, two populations look so different that they can no longer be assigned to the same species.
We call this process speciation, which simply means the creation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from the technological push or the technological imperative to the strict sense that human destiny is determined by a fundamental logic that is linked to scientific laws and its manifestation in technology.

Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general views. One, that the development of technology follows a path that is largely outside the influence of cultural or political forces, and two, that technology itself has effects on societies that are more inherent than socially determined.
One could say that the development of roads is inextricably linked to the car.
However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for a small number of cars. Therefore, new production methods are being developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.

German baked goods are quite tasty. In Bavaria they are quite nutritious and varied, just as in the southern neighbor Austria.
Fruit cake is widely available, with apples being sold as cake all year round and cherries and plums used in the summer.

A curry can be either "dry" or "wet" depending on the amount of liquid.

With over 17,000 islands, Indonesian cuisine is an umbrella term that encompasses a wide variety of regional cuisines found throughout the country.
However, if the term is used without further attributes, it usually refers to the food that originally came from the central and eastern parts of the main island of Java.

The Javanese cuisine, which is now widespread throughout the island group, offers a variety of simply spiced dishes. Javanese prefer to use peanuts, chilis, sugar (especially Javanese coconut sugar) and a variety of aromatic spices as flavorings.
Spurs are aids for the feet of riders, which hang down on both sides of the saddle.
They give the rider more stability, but there are safety concerns because the rider's feet might get caught in them.
If a rider falls off a horse and gets caught in the stirrup, he can be dragged along if the horse runs. To minimize this risk, a number of safety measures can be taken.
First of all, most riders wear riding boots with a heel and a relatively narrow sole.
In addition, some saddles, especially English saddles, have safety bows that allow a stirrup leather to fall from the saddle when pulled backwards by a falling rider.
Cochamó Valley – Chile's most important climbing destination, known as the Yosemite National Park of South America, with a multitude of large granite walls and cliffs.
The peaks offer a breathtaking view. Climbers from all over the world keep discovering new routes along the walls, which offer endless possibilities.
Downhill sports such as skiing and snowboarding are popular sports in which you attach skis or a snowboard to your feet and ride down a snow-covered slope.
Skiing is a popular travel activity with many enthusiasts, sometimes known as "ski bums", who plan their entire vacation around skiing at a particular location.
The idea of skiing is very old – cave paintings with depictions of skiers go back to 5000 BC!
The origins of skiing as a sport go back at least to the 17th century and in 1861 the first recreational ski club in Australia was opened by Norwegians.
Ski touring with backpack: This activity is also called ski touring or ski hiking.
It resembles alpine touring skiing or mountaineering, but does not necessarily include it, since the latter involves steep terrain and requires much firmer skis and boots.
Consider the ski route like a comparable hiking route.
With good conditions, you're able to cover larger distances than when hiking – only very rarely will you reach the speed of cross-country skiing on well-maintained trails without a heavy backpack.

Europe is a relatively small continent, but has numerous independent countries. Normally, one would have to apply for multiple visas and go through multiple passport controls if one wanted to travel through several countries.
However, the Schengen area works in this respect somewhat like a country.
As long as you stay in this zone, you can normally cross the border without having to go through passport control again.
Accordingly, you do not need to apply for a visa for each of the Schengen member states individually, which saves time, money and bureaucracy.
There is no universally accepted definition of what constitutes an antique. Some tax authorities define antiques as objects over 100 years old.
The definition shows geographic variations, where the age limit is lower in places like North America than in Europe.

Strong winds, hail, excessive rainfall and forest fires are forms and effects of weather, as are thunderstorms, tornados, flash floods and hurricanes.
Regional and seasonal weather phenomena include blizzards, snowstorms, dust storms and hailstorms.

Rip-currents are the returning current of broken waves at the shore, often at reefs or similar.
Because of the underwater topography, the outflow concentrates in a few deeper areas and a fast current can form in deeper water.
The majority of deaths occur due to exhaustion while trying to swim against the current, which can prove impossible.
If you get out of the current, swimming back is no more difficult than normal.
Try to get somewhere where you won't be caught again. Alternatively, if you have the skills and if you've been spotted, maybe you should wait for rescue.
The reverse culture shock comes earlier than the culture shock (the honeymoon phase is not so pronounced), lasts longer and can be more severe.
Travelers who find it easy to adapt to the new culture sometimes find it particularly difficult to adapt to their home culture.
When you return from an overseas stay, you have adapted to a different culture and dropped some of your home culture's behaviors.
When you first travel abroad, people are likely to be patient and understanding, because they know that travelers have to adjust to a new country.
It is perhaps not expected that even returning travellers will require patience and understanding.

Couriers are well paid for the speedy delivery of things. Often time is a very important factor when it comes to business documents, commercial goods or urgent repairs.

Christmas is one of the most important days in Christianity and is regarded as the birthday of Jesus.
Many of the traditions associated with the holiday have been adopted by non-believers in Christian and non-Christian countries.
There is the tradition of spending the Easter night at any open spot to see the sunrise.
Of course, there are Christian-theological explanations for this tradition, but it could also be a pre-Christian spring and fertility ritual.

Traditional churches often hold an Easter Vigil on Saturday evening, during the Easter weekend, when the celebrations of the congregations often begin at midnight, when the resurrection of Christ is celebrated.
All animals that originally arrived on the islands came either by swimming, flying or by being washed ashore.

The Japanese work culture is hierarchical and formal than what Westerners may be used to.
Suit jackets are part of the standard business attire and colleagues address each other by their family names or job titles.
Workplace harmony is of great importance, with the focus more on group performance than on individual praise.
Employees often have to get the approval of their superiors for every decision they make, and it is expected that they will follow their bosses' orders without question.
